programme.title: Live NFL
programme.desc: Las Vegas Raiders v Los Angeles Chargers (Kick-off 3.00am). Coverage of the week two match at Allegiant Stadium. These two sides last met at the start of this year when the visitors came away with a 34-20 victory.(n)

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: In early 20th-century Vienna, a man becomes obsessed with the art of conjuring after an encounter with a travelling magician. He decides to leave his homeland to explore the world and perfect his skills. He returns years later a very talented illusionist, and is bent on using his gift to save the love of his life from a marriage to a cruel and vicious prince. Mystery thriller, starring Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti, Jessica Biel and Rufus Sewell.(n)

programme.title: Ordinary Angels
programme.desc: A struggling hairdresser discovers a new sense of purpose when she meets a widower working to provide for his daughters. Drama, starring Hilary Swank, Alan Ritchson and Nancy Travis.(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Rebellious American teenager Danny falls for innocent Australian girl Sandy during the summer holidays, but when he later finds out she is a new student at his school, he risks losing her love by trying to act cool in front of his friends. Romantic musical set in the 1950s, starring John Travolta, Olivia Newton-John, Stockard Channing, Jeff Conaway, Didi Conn and Sid Caesar.(n)

programme.title: Grease 2
programme.desc: A shy English boy joins the senior class at Rydell High and immediately falls for the leader of the Pink Ladies. But she is only interested in tough guys, forcing him to adopt a dual identity as a mysterious biker. Musical sequel, starring Michelle Pfeiffer, Maxwell Caulfield, Lorna Luft, Eve Arden and Sid Caesar, with Didi Conn reprising her role as Frenchy from the original film.(n)

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: The younger son of George V struggles to cope with an uncontrollable stammer, prompting his wife to enlist the aid of an eccentric Australian speech therapist. The support and friendship of the doctor prove invaluable when a crisis places the repressed prince on the throne, just as the outbreak of the Second World War leaves the country in need of a strong king. Oscar-winning fact-based drama, starring Colin Firth, Geoffrey Rush, Helena Bonham Carter and Guy Pearce.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A streetwise Brooklyn teenager struggles to cope with a dead-end job and a dysfunctional family. However, he finds an escape in the disco scene, where he falls in love with a woman dreaming of breaking free from her equally poor background to pursue a brighter future in Manhattan. Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees.(n)

programme.title: Midnight Express
programme.desc: An American student is arrested for drug smuggling while on holiday in Turkey, and thrown into a brutal prison ruled by a sadistic warder. His family and the US government plan an appeal, but he begins to realise that diplomatic efforts are fruitless, and his only hope is to plot a desperate escape. Alan Parker's fact-based drama, starring Brad Davis, John Hurt and Randy Quaid.(n)

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.(n)

programme.title: The Quiet Man
programme.desc: An American prizefighter retires after killing an opponent in the ring, and returns to his Irish roots in a village in Galway, where he falls for a local woman. Unfortunately, their romance is hampered by a conflict with her brother over a property matter. John Ford's Oscar-winning romantic comedy drama, starring John Wayne, Maureen O'Hara, Victor McLaglen, Barry Fitzgerald and Ward Bond.(n)

programme.title: Pawn Sacrifice
programme.desc: American chess prodigy Bobby Fischer challenges the best player in the Soviet Union in a top championship, causing the two nations to use the event to fuel their respective agendas. Fischer soon finds himself caught between the two superpowers as well as having to deal with his own struggles. Tobey Maguire and Liev Schreiber star in this fact-based sporting drama set in 1972 during the Cold War.(n)

programme.title: My First Summer
programme.desc: Isolated on a remote property after her mother's death, 16-year-old Claudia finds her world transformed when spirited teenager Grace appears. Drama, starring Markella Kavenagh and Maiah Stewardson.(n)

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.(n)

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Barton Academy boarding school teacher Paul Hunham incurs the wrath of headmaster Dr Hardy Woodrup by failing the son of a powerful senator. As punishment, Woodrup selects Paul to remain on campus over Christmas to chaperone the boys who won't be travelling home for the holidays. Alexander Payne's comedy drama, starring Paul Giamatti, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa.(n)

programme.title: Girl You Know It's True
programme.desc: During the 1980s, dancers Rob Pilatus and Fabrice Morvan become pop stars as Milli Vanilli, but unknown to their fans, they are lip-syncing to other artists. Biographical drama, starring Elan Ben Ali, Tijan Njie and Matthias Schweighofer.(n)

programme.title: Bob Marley: One Love
programme.desc: In 1976, Jamaica is dangerously divided across political lines and musician Bob Marley vows to quell the violence by performing at the Smile Jamaica Concert. Two days before the high-profile gig, gunmen break into the singer's home, shooting Bob, his wife Rita and manager Don Taylor. Everyone survives and Marley moves to London with his entourage to begin work on the LP Exodus under Island Records supremo Chris Blackwell. Biographical drama, starring Kingsley Ben-Adir, Lashana Lynch and James Norton.(n)

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.(n)

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: An alcoholic former professional player reluctantly agrees to train an all-female baseball team during the Second World War. With star player Dottie Hinson and her sister Kit on board, they look set to dominate the league - until sibling rivalry rears its head. Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.

programme.title: The Color Purple
programme.desc: Teenager Celie suffers horribly at the hands of her abusive father Alfonso until she is married off against her will to local farmer Mister, who expects her to take care of his three children. Celie's spirited sister Nettie refuses to submit to Mister and leaves Georgia, but promises to write every day. Years pass and Celie has been worn down to quiet subservience, until Mister's mistress, sultry jazz singer Shug Avery, sashays into town and lights a fire in the broken wife. Musical drama based on Alice Walker's 1982 novel, starring Fantasia Barrino, Taraji P Henson, Colman Domingo and Danielle Brooks.

programme.title: Freud's Last Session
programme.desc: Sigmund Freud invites CS Lewis to debate the existence of God. Drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Matthew Goode and Liv Lisa Fries.

programme.title: Parachute
programme.desc: Riley, a young woman recently released from rehab, meets Ethan and finds herself navigating the line between love and a new addiction. Director Brittany Snow's romantic comedy drama, starring Courtney Eaton, Thomas Mann and Dave Bautista.

programme.title: Nobody's Fool
programme.desc: Ageing rebel Sully has spent a lifetime avoiding responsibility. When Sully is reunited with his estranged son, he learns he is a grandfather, forcing him to reassess his attitudes and driving him to get to know his family before it is too late. Comedy drama, starring Paul Newman, Dylan Walsh, Bruce Willis and Melanie Griffith.

Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

programme.title: Saturday Night Fever
programme.desc: A streetwise Brooklyn teenager struggles to cope with a dead-end job and a dysfunctional family. However, he finds an escape in the disco scene, where he falls in love with a woman dreaming of breaking free from her equally poor background to pursue a brighter future in Manhattan. Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees.

programme.title: Parachute
programme.desc: Riley, a young woman recently released from rehab, meets Ethan and finds herself navigating the line between love and a new addiction. Director Brittany Snow's romantic comedy drama, starring Courtney Eaton, Thomas Mann and Dave Bautista.

programme.title: The Holiday
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Einar realises that the woman in the painting is his true identity, and decides to become one of the first people to undergo sex reassignment surgery. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Young at Heart
programme.desc: Three sisters, all talented musicians, fall for the upbeat songwriter who is lodging with them - but when he invites a morose and lonely pianist to help arrange his score, events for the ladies take an unexpected turn. Romantic musical, starring Frank Sinatra, Gig Young, Doris Day, Ethel Barrymore, Dorothy Malone and Elisabeth Fraser.

programme.title: Chuck Chuck Baby
programme.desc: Helen lives with her ex-husband, his 20-year-old girlfriend, their new baby, and his dying mother Gwen. Helen's life is a grind, but she has a chance at romance when a secret love returns. Writer/director Janis Pugh's drama, starring Louise Brealey and Annabel Scholey.

programme.title: The Convert
programme.desc: A preacher's past is revived during a war between two Maori tribes. Co-writer/director Lee Tamahori's action drama, starring Guy Pearce and Tioreore Ngatai-Melbourne.

programme.title: There Will Be Blood
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier.

programme.title: I Used to Be Funny
programme.desc: A stand-up comedian struggling with PTSD agonises over whether or not to join the search for a missing teenage girl she used to look after. Writer-director Ally Pankiw's comedy drama, starring Rachel Sennott and Olga Petsa.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: Chicago
programme.desc: Two female jailbirds imprisoned for murder pull out all the stops to seize the attention of the media. Aided by a slick lawyer, both women are desperate to find fame and fortune and escape the death penalty by winning public sympathy. Musical, starring Renee Zellweger, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Richard Gere, John C Reilly and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: The Great Escaper
programme.desc: Former Royal Navy officer Bernie Jordan is happily settled with wife Rene at a care home. Unfortunately, he hasn't secured a place on the official British Royal Legion trip to France to the commemorate the 70th anniversary of the D-Day landings. Bernie needs to make the trip to Normandy for personal reasons, and with Rene's blessing, he sneaks off to pay his respects. Drama, starring Michael Caine and Glenda Jackson in her final film.

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.

Drama, starring John Travolta, Karen Lynn Gorney and Paul Pape, and featuring songs by the Bee Gees.

programme.title: The Good Half
programme.desc: Returning home for his mother's funeral, Renn Wheeland forges new relationships and heals old ones as he faces his grief. Drama, starring Nick Jonas, David Arquette and Brittany Snow.

programme.title: A League of Their Own
programme.desc: An alcoholic former professional player reluctantly agrees to train an all-female baseball team during the Second World War. With star player Dottie Hinson and her sister Kit on board, they look set to dominate the league - until sibling rivalry rears its head. Comedy drama, starring Geena Davis, Lori Petty, Tom Hanks and Madonna.

programme.title: A Mistake
programme.desc: A talented surgeon's life unravels after an inexperienced colleague makes a fatal mistake. Medical drama, starring Elizabeth Banks, Simon McBurney and Joel Tolbeck.

programme.title: Schindler's List
programme.desc: In German-occupied Poland during the Second World War, businessman and Nazi Party member Oskar Schindler is deeply affected when he witnesses the clearing of the Krakow Ghetto. He decides to try to save Jews destined for the concentration camps by employing them in his factory - an act of mercy made possible by a deal struck with a sadistic German commandant. Steven Spielberg's Oscar-winning drama, starring Liam Neeson, Ben Kingsley and Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: Dunkirk
programme.desc: Allied soldiers from Belgium, the British Empire and France are surrounded by the German army, and face a tense wait for evacuation, during a fierce battle in northern France during the Second World War. Christopher Nolan's wartime drama, which he wrote, directed and produced, starring Kenneth Branagh, Tom Hardy, Mark Rylance and Fionn Whitehead.

programme.title: The Sons of Katie Elder
programme.desc: Four brothers are reunited at their mother's funeral and discover their father was swindled out of his farm and subsequently murdered. However, as they set about avenging his death and reclaiming his land, a crook frames them for killing the sheriff. Western, starring John Wayne, Dean Martin, Earl Holliman, Michael Anderson Jr, James Gregory, George Kennedy and Dennis Hopper.

programme.title: Valentine's Day
programme.desc: Anthology of stories charting the romantic complications of various Los Angeles residents. A businessman and a soldier on leave share a flight home, a teacher is smitten with a doctor and an elderly couple comfort their lovesick grandson. Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.

programme.title: Black Dog
programme.desc: As part of a patrol tasked with clearing stray dogs before the 2008 Olympics, former stunt motorcyclist Lang bonds with a hound. Drama, starring Eddie Peng and Tong Liya. In Chinese with English subtitles.

programme.title: Skincare
programme.desc: Small business owner Hope Goldman performs facials to celebrity clientele and powerful businesswomen. She is poised to launch her own skincare line, but is in arrears with rent on her store at a shopping complex. A rival called Angel opens in close proximity and soon after, her email is hacked and tyres slashed. Hope is convinced that Angel is the culprit and enlists hired thug Armen and young beau Jordan to extinguish the competition. Director Austin Peters' thriller, starring Elizabeth Banks and Lewis Pullman.

programme.title: Boy Meets Boy
programme.desc: When two young men cross paths in Berlin, a simple afternoon in the big city soon takes on a much greater meaning. Drama, starring Matthew Morrison and Alexandros Koutsoulis.(n)

programme.title: El Dorado
programme.desc: An ageing gunfighter is drawn into the conflict between a land-grabbing cattle baron and a ranching family, but gets wounded in the process. A year later, he returns to town to find the situation has not improved - so along with his sidekick and the drunken town sheriff, he fights to defend the family from its enemies. Western, starring John Wayne, Robert Mitchum, James Caan and Ed Asner.(n)

programme.title: Love Actually
programme.desc: Ten interlinked stories of people searching for and finding love. While the newly elected, bachelor British prime minister is smitten by a junior staff member at 10 Downing Street, a heartbroken writer heads for France to get over a failed relationship, and a faded rock star aims to reinvent himself in time for Christmas. Richard Curtis's romantic comedy, with Hugh Grant, Martine McCutcheon, Emma Thompson, Alan Rickman, Colin Firth, Bill Nighy and Liam Neeson.(n)

programme.title: True Grit
programme.desc: One-eyed, over-the-hill US Marshal Rooster Cogburn reluctantly agrees to help a girl track down her father's killer. The quest is complicated by a Texas Ranger, who is also on the murderer's trail, and a host of villains who have few qualms about disposing of the meddling youngster and her protector. Western, starring an Oscar-winning John Wayne alongside Jeff Corey, Kim Darby, Glen Campbell, Robert Duvall and Dennis Hopper.(n)

programme.title: There Will Be Blood

Romantic comedy drama, with Ashton Kutcher, Jessica Alba, Jamie Foxx, Jennifer Garner and Julia Roberts.(n)

programme.title: PS I Love You
programme.desc: Widowed Holly feels she cannot cope following the death of her husband. However, on her birthday, she receives a letter he wrote to her just before he died, encouraging her to live life to the full rather than languish in sorrow. This is just the first in a series of messages, each one sending her on wild misadventures and helping her to move on. Romantic drama based on Cecelia Ahern's novel, starring Hilary Swank, Gerard Butler and Lisa Kudrow.(n)

programme.title: The Holdovers
programme.desc: Barton Academy boarding school teacher Paul Hunham incurs the wrath of headmaster Dr Hardy Woodrup by failing the son of a powerful senator. As punishment, Woodrup selects Paul to remain on campus over Christmas to chaperone the boys who won't be travelling home for the holidays. Alexander Payne's comedy drama, starring Paul Giamatti, Da'Vine Joy Randolph and Dominic Sessa.(n)

programme.title: The Danish Girl
programme.desc: Artist Gerda Wegener unveils a portrait of her husband Einar dressed as a woman in 1920s Copenhagen. Period drama based on David Ebershoff's novel inspired by the true story of artist Lili Elbe, starring Eddie Redmayne and an Oscar-winning Alicia Vikander.(n)

programme.title: Into the Wonderwoods
programme.desc: Young Angelo dreams of becoming an explorer and a zoologist. When he goes to visit his granny, his parents leave him behind at a rest stop, and he decides to cut through the forest in search of them. Animated adventure, featuring the voice of Kristen McGuire.(n)

programme.title: The Prosecutor
programme.desc: An ex-prosecutor investigates when a man falsely pleads guilty to drug trafficking after being framed, uncovering a corrupt lawyer's scheme and fighting to restore justice - despite obstruction from evil forces. Action thriller, starring Donnie Yen, Julian Cheung and Francis Ng. In Cantonese.(n)

programme.title: One of Them Days
programme.desc: When best friends and roommates Dreux and Alyssa discover the latter's boyfriend has blown their rent money, the duo faces a race against time to avoid eviction. Comedy, starring Keke Palmer and SZA.(n)

programme.title: The Mountain
programme.desc: Sam, a fearless young girl raised outside of her Maori culture, is determined to connect with a mountain in the hope it can cure her cancer. Along the way she meets new friends Mallory and Bronco. Co-writer/director Rachel House's comedy, starring Elizabeth Atkinson, Reuben Francis, Terence Daniel and Byron Coll.(n)

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon.(n)

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: Helm Hammerhand sits on the throne of Rohan, flanked by sons Hama and Haleth and rebellious daughter Hera. Dunlending lord Freca proposes a marital union between Hera and his son Wulf, which Helm loudly rejects. In a subsequent brawl between fathers, Helm unintentionally lands a fatal blow, so Wulf vows revenge and amasses an army led by General Targg. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gaia Wise, Brian Cox, Luke Pasqualino and Lorraine Ashbourne.(n)

programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. Thomas leaves his bride Ellen in the care of friend Friedrich Harding and his wife Anna. The young man barely survives the exhausting trip to Europe and stumbles home to find Ellen driven to delirium by a telepathic bond to the Count. Director Robert Eggers' version of the Dracula-inspired horror, starring Bill Skarsgard, Lily-Rose Depp, Nicholas Hoult and Aaron Taylor-Johnson.

programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young couple flee the city during a zombie outbreak, only to be involved in a car crash. When the man awakes, his girlfriend is missing, so he bands together with a rugged survivalist to find his partner - but he only has selected memories of what he has been through. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray.

programme.title: One of Them Days
programme.desc: When best friends and roommates Dreux and Alyssa discover the latter's boyfriend has blown their rent money, the duo faces a race against time to avoid eviction. Comedy, starring Keke Palmer and SZA.

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon.

programme.title: Die Alone
programme.desc: A young couple flee the city during a zombie outbreak, only to be involved in a car crash. When the man awakes, his girlfriend is missing, so he bands together with a rugged survivalist to find his partner - but he only has selected memories of what he has been through. Apocalypse drama, starring Carrie-Anne Moss, Douglas Smith, Frank Grillo and Kimberley-Sue Murray.

programme.title: Nosferatu
programme.desc: In 1838 Germany, Thomas Hutter is sent to the Carpathian mountains to secure the signature of enigmatic nobleman Count Orlok on a property sale in the German city of Wisborg. Thomas leaves his bride Ellen in the care of friend Friedrich Harding and his wife Anna. The young man barely survives the exhausting trip to Europe and stumbles home to find Ellen driven to delirium by a telepathic bond to the Count. Director Robert Eggers' version of the Dracula-inspired horror, starring Bill Skarsgard, Lily-Rose Depp, Nicholas Hoult and Aaron Taylor-Johnson.

programme.title: Spin the Bottle
programme.desc: When a group of friends play spin the bottle in a house marked by a brutal massacre, they unknowingly unleash an evil spirit and start dying in terrifying ways. The survivors must stick together to uncover the house's secrets and end the bloodshed. Horror starring Tanner Stine and Kaylee Kaneshiro.

programme.title: The Brutalist
programme.desc: When a couple flee Europe in 1947, their new lives in the US are changed by a strange client. Director Brady Corbet's drama, starring Adrien Brody, Felicity Jones, Guy Pearce and Joe Alwyn.

programme.title: Night Call
programme.desc: After responding to an emergency call from a mysterious woman, a young locksmith gets unwittingly caught in the crosshairs of a ruthless mob boss. Thriller, starring Jonas Bloquet and Mustii. In French with English subtitles.

programme.title: Amongst the Wolves
programme.desc: An ex-soldier meets a teen fleeing a gang, an encounter which forces them to confront their pasts while navigating present realities. Director Mark O'Connor's thriller, starring Luke McQuillan, Aidan Gillen and Daniel Fee.(n)

programme.title: The Surfer

programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The War of the Rohirrim
programme.desc: Helm Hammerhand sits on the throne of Rohan, flanked by sons Hama and Haleth and rebellious daughter Hera. Dunlending lord Freca proposes a marital union between Hera and his son Wulf, which Helm loudly rejects. In a subsequent brawl between fathers, Helm unintentionally lands a fatal blow, so Wulf vows revenge and amasses an army led by General Targg. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of Gaia Wise, Brian Cox, Luke Pasqualino and Lorraine Ashbourne.(n)

programme.title: Mr Deeds
programme.desc: Smalltown chump Adam Sandler inherits a fortune (plus sneaky butler John Turturro). But his wealth draws gold-diggers and tricky reporter Winona Ryder.

programme.title: The Men Who Stare At Goats
programme.desc: A reporter gets the scoop of a lifetime when he meets US Army veteran George Clooney, who reveals he was part of a unit training psychic spies. Satirical black comedy.

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: Johnny Depp stars as Peter Pan author J M Barrie, whose friendship with a young family inspires him to write his most famous work. Touching drama with Kate Winslet.

programme.title: Nacho Libre
programme.desc: Orphanage chef Jack Black cooks up a plan to earn money for the kids by becoming a Mexican wrestler. Comedy from the director of Napoleon Dynamite.

programme.title: The Hangover
programme.desc: Four guys go to Las Vegas for a bachelor party, only to wake up with a trashed room, a missing groom and no memory of the night before. Hit comedy. Strong language/sex.

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: A pair of high-school seniors plan an ill-fated night of debauchery before heading off to college. Riotous comedy starring Michael Cera and Jonah Hill. (2007.

programme.title: Tropic Thunder
programme.desc: Lines between fiction and reality are blurred when a war movie's cast are attacked. Ben Stiller stars. Discriminatory content/strong language/violence/flashing images.

programme.title: Snakes On A Plane
programme.desc: FBI agent Samuel L Jackson is escorting a murder witness, but has to play hero when his plane is overrun with hordes of venomous snakes. Brilliantly bonkers thriller.

programme.title: Charlie's Angels
programme.desc: Cameron Diaz, Lucy Liu and Drew Barrymore star as the crime-fighting trio in this explosive action comedy. Violence/sex.

programme.desc: Foxy crimefighters Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Lucy Liu spring into action to stop a murder plot led by rogue 'angel' Demi Moore. Violence/flashing images.

programme.desc: Superman blasts back to do battle with his nemesis, but can evil Lex Luthor temper the Man of Steel? Kryptonite-charged showdown with Kevin Spacey. Contains flashing images.

programme.title: The Patriot
programme.desc: A man must protect his family in this all-action epic set against the American War of Independence. Mel Gibson and Heath Ledger star. Violence.

programme.desc: A group of friends keep the cameras rolling as a skyscraper-sized monster rampages through Manhattan. Found-footage creature feature. Violence/mature themes.

programme.desc: Though struggling with the ramifications of his extraordinary origin and abilities, young Clark Kent (Henry Cavill) must become a hero and save those he loves from a dire threat.

programme.title: Mr. Church
programme.desc: When a young girl and her dying mother are joined by a black male cook who comes to live with them, little do they know that their lives are about to change forever.

programme.title: A Minecraft Movie
programme.desc: A mysterious portal pulls four misfits into the Overworld, a bizarre, cubic wonderland that thrives on imagination. To get back home, they'll have to master the terrain while embarking on a magical quest with an unexpected crafter named Steve.

programme.title: Real Time With Bill Maher

programme.title: Prometheus
